definition: good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: That’s because power quickly turns us into hypocrites.
sentences.chinese: 那是因为权力会很快把我们变成伪善者。

sentences.english: You say you care about the poor, but you don't help them, you hypocrite!
sentences.chinese: 你说你关心穷人，可你并不帮助他们，你这伪善者。

sentences.english: We're embarrassed, and we don't want to be, God forbid, hypocrites.
sentences.chinese: 我们很尴尬，而且我们并不想当伪善者。

definition: to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
everything for self and selfish profit (idiom); with no regard for others/selfish/mercenary
